intro: Najas interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater ecosystems in North America. It has slender, branching stems that are often reddish in color and bear small, whorled leaves. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically found in clusters near the water surface. Najas interrupta plays a role in aquatic habitats by providing shelter for aquatic organisms and contributing to water clarity. It is often found in slow-moving or still waters such as lakes and ponds.
